Data: Morkel to Warner, no run length delivery on the off stump with the angle, pushed to cover
Morkel to Warner, no run pitches it a touch shorter and gets the extra bounce as Warner takes one hand off the bat while defending to cover point
Morkel to Warner, 1 run back of length and closer to the batsman, Warner goes back and turns it to fine leg
Morkel to Finch, 1 run back of length on the off side, Finch goes on his toes and whips it to square leg with the wrists for one
Morkel to Warner, no run makes room for a wild swing, but the ball was shorter than he thought and he missed it completely as it bounced over the bat outside off
Morkel to Warner, 1 run length delivery outside off now, pushed towards cover for one
McLaren to Warner, no run back of length outside off, Warner taps it towards point and Miller dives to his left from backward point, making Warner go back in the crease
McLaren to Warner, 1 run short ball on middle and leg, pulled with some power but straight to deep square leg
McLaren to Finch, FOUR runs that's too short and wide, and Finch slams it through the off side in the wide gap off the back foot for four
McLaren to Finch, 2 runs still pretty short outside off, swishes it past backward point for two more towards third man

McLaren to Finch, SIX runs slightly slower at 121kph, but it's too full now and Finch launches it down the ground to the long off boundary for six! Mid off was in and he only had to clear that fielder, but he went all the way
McLaren to Finch, no run good delivery to end the over - brings it in towards the stumps from outside off, no room and he defends it on leg
Philander to Warner, no run towards the off stump from back of length, Warner defends it back
Philander to Warner, 1 run outside the off stump on length, driven into the covers for one
Philander to Finch, no run taps the back of length delivery outside off, wants the run but decides against it
Philander to Finch, no run brings it in a bit from just outside off, Finch defends it on leg off the back foot

Philander to Finch, 1 leg bye appeal for lbw, the length delivery seamed in from outside off and hit Finch above the knee roll in front of the stumps and he was a step outside the crease too. HawkEye says that was going over
Philander to Warner, no run towards middle and off stump, tucked on the leg side off the back foot
Tahir to Finch, FOUR runs that's a really poor delivery to start with, or bowl anytime in the match, a really short delivery on the stumps, he went back and pulled it for four
Tahir to Finch, 1 run short again, towards off and he cuts it off the back foot on the off side for one
Tahir to Warner, 2 runs fullish outside off, pushed through the covers but not very firmly and they run very well to take two
Tahir to Warner, no run slow and short outside off, punched off the back foot to cover point
Tahir to Warner, SIX runs too full, Warner goes down on a knee and slog-sweeps it for a massive six to the cow corner boundary. He was playing it with the turn and absolutely middled it
Tahir to Warner, 2 runs wide outside off now, driven firmly wide of long-off for two more
Philander to Finch, 1 run run out chance - taps the ball to cover where Amla runs to get to the ball quickly, has a shy at the stumps but they are too quick

Philander to Warner, OUT that's a great catch in the deep from McLaren and the stand is broken! Warner pulled the short ball in the air again, McLaren ran to his left from square leg but the ball was dipping on him and he made sure he swooped down with a dive to get his hands under the ball comfortably to complete the catch
Philander to Finch, no run slightly back of length outside off, defends it off the back foot

Philander to Finch, OUT oh another, Philander gets Finch too! He moved the delivery away from Finch from outside off, the batsman pushed at it away from the body and the ball did enough to take an edge for an easy catch for de Kock
Philander to Clarke, no run 132.1kph, straightish delivery outside off on length, Clarke defends it back to Philander
Philander to Clarke, no run back of length outside the off stump, defended off the back foot towards cover
Tahir to Watson, no run bit of flight on length outside off, he presses forward to defend it back
Tahir to Watson, no run pretty flat towards middle and leg, looked like a flipper, he tucked it to backward square leg
Tahir to Watson, no run goes in the crease and defends the googly on the leg side
Tahir to Watson, no run length delivery just outside off, leans forward and blocks again
Tahir to Watson, 1 run much shorter on the leg stump, Watson goes back and tucks it to midwicket to get off the mark
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run short and flat on middle and leg, clipped off the pads to backward square leg
Philander to Clarke, no run back of length outside off and moves it away from the batsman, left alone
Philander to Clarke, no run shapes it away from outside off again, he shoulders arms
Philander to Clarke, no run angled in a bit this time, Clarke pushes this one to short midwicket
Philander to Clarke, no run straight delivery on the off stump, defends it down to mid-on
Philander to Clarke, no run 128kph, slightly back of length delivery on the off stump, Clarke defends again
Philander to Clarke, 1 run seams it in a bit from outside off, thick inside edge goes to the leg side for one
Tahir to Clarke, 1 run low full toss on the pads, driven down the ground to long on for one
Tahir to Watson, no run nice shape and turn outside off as Watson reaches out to defend it to backward point
Tahir to Watson, no run flattish outside off and bit of turn, he defends off the back foot
Tahir to Watson, no run leans froward this time and defends it from length
Tahir to Watson, 1 run reaches out and turns the ball down to long for one
Tahir to Clarke, no run turns in the wrong one from outside off, Clarke picks it and defends it on leg
Steyn to Watson, 1 leg bye angled in towards the pads, it deflects down leg for a leg bye and it brings up the 100
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run slightly fuller on the off stump, the wobbled seam takes an inside edge for one on the leg side
Steyn to Watson, 1 run strays towards the pads, worked to the leg side for one
Steyn to Clarke, no run bangs in the short ball outside off, Clarke stayed back and defended it uppishly off the top of the bat towards point
Steyn to Clarke, no run 140kph, short again outside off, good bounce of course, and Clarke goes on his toes to defend it close to himself
Steyn to Clarke, no run not as short, but short delivery towards middle stump this time, Clarke stays in the crease and defends it on leg
Tahir to Watson, no run bit of flight and on length on the leg stump, defended towards midwicket
Tahir to Watson, no run shorter and quicker on the stumps, he goes back to cut and gets his bat down just in time
Tahir to Watson, 1 run takes a step down and lofts it in the air, not from the middle of the bat though, towards the covers
Tahir to Clarke, 2 runs strays towards the leg side now and a thin edge goes past the keeper on the leg side
Tahir to Clarke, FOUR runs flat towards the leg side again, this time it's played off the pads fine down the leg side to beat fine leg for four
Tahir to Clarke, no run fuller towards the off stump, he blocks it back down the ground
Steyn to Watson, 1 run length delivery on the off stump, tucked on the leg side for one
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run worked to square leg off the back foot as Steyn pitches it shorter
Steyn to Watson, 1 run shapes it in towards middle and leg from length, helped down to fine leg for one more

Steyn to Clarke, OUT there you go - Steyn gets Clarke's wicket! Steyn banged in a short ball around off, Clarke took a step towards off and pulled but didn't time it properly and the ball ballooned off the glove towards de Kock. You won't see an easier catch than that

Steyn to Bailey, 4 leg byes what a delivery to welcome a new batsman! Nast short delivery angled towards Bailey's head, he sways out of the line a bit, then takes his eyes off the ball and it deflects off the back for four over the keeper
Steyn to Bailey, no run
Tahir to Watson, no run fullish on the stumps, he defends it back to the bowler
Tahir to Watson, 1 run takes a step down and drives the length delivery to long off
Tahir to Bailey, no run flat outside off, he goes back and defends it on off
Tahir to Bailey, no run flighted and full, he pushes it back to the bowler
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run full around the off stump, driven through the covers for one
Tahir to Watson, no run slower through the air outside off, he reaches out and defends it on off
Morkel to Bailey, no run back of length outside off, taps it to point off the back foot
Morkel to Bailey, no run slower at 128kph and well outside off, pushed straight to cover
Morkel to Bailey, no run brings it in sharply towards the stumps, Bailey looks to defend but is beaten and takes it on the pads
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run angled down the leg side and it's worked off the pads to fine leg
Morkel to Watson, 1 run driven handsomely through the covers, what a beautiful drive from Watson but Faf runs from mid-off and dives full length to save a few runs

Morkel to Bailey, no run dropped, Miller has put down Bailey at point! It was short outside off with room, Bailey cut it straight to point, Miller goes both his hands to it to his left around the shoulders but the ball popped out immediately
Tahir to Watson, no run flat and straight on middle stump, defends it off the back foot
Tahir to Watson, 1 run turns in the googly from outside off, worked off the back foot towards backward square leg
Tahir to Bailey, no run one more put down! fulld elviery was chipped back to Tahir, he jumped a bit to catch it but couldn't hold on to it. Spilt an easy catch
Tahir to Bailey, no run turns in the googly again, he defends on the leg side
Tahir to Bailey, no run goes on the back foot and defends the flat ball outside off
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run fuller outside off and it's driven with the turn to the covers for one
Morkel to Bailey, 2 runs short ball outside off, pulls it wide of midwicket for two in the gap to wide long on
Morkel to Bailey, no run short and wide outside off, this time he taps it to point by pointing the bat down
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run closer to the stumps but still wide enough and he guides it to third man for one
Morkel to Watson, no run appeal for caught behind as the ball went through the batsman, the bounce made him hop on the back foot and the ball took touched the short maybe on its way

Morkel to Watson, no run nearly a run out chance! Watson tucked the fuller delivery to short midwicket, AB stopped the ball but he had to throw the ball with his left hand and it merely rolled towards the stumps as Bailey came back
Morkel to Watson, FOUR runs short ball just outside off, Watson plays the ramp shot and guides the ball over the keeper and slip for four
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run full on the stumps, driven down to long on for one
Tahir to Watson, no run turn outside off as Watson reaches out for the ball and an edge goes towards backward point
Tahir to Watson, OUT a catch has been taken - finally! Watson swept the full delivery on the pads to short fine leg and Morkel did well to get low and get his hands under the ball just in time
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run full and flighted outside off, driven down the ground to long off
Tahir to Bailey, no run flighted googly turns in from outside off, he defends it back
Tahir to Bailey, no run flighted on length on the off stump, he leans forward and blocks it again
Morkel to Marsh, no run back of length outside off, he stays on the back foot and defends it
Morkel to Marsh, no run brings in the length delivery towards off stump, drives it down the ground
Morkel to Marsh, no run back of length outside the off stump, he defends it back to the bowler
Morkel to Marsh, no run short ball towards middle and leg, goes on his toes to defend it close to himself
Morkel to Marsh, no run touch short of length outside off, he leans forward and pushes it to cover
Morkel to Marsh, no run short of length outside off, he defends it off the back foot
Tahir to Bailey, no run bit of flight on leg stump, tucked to the leg side but short leg stops it
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run flatter towards the leg stump again, worked to fine leg for one
Tahir to Marsh, 2 runs slower and wider outside off, it was a googly and he chopped it off the back foot to point
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run length delivery around off stump, pushed with the turn towards cover
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run full and outside off, driven firmly to sweeper cover
Tahir to Marsh, 1 run flighted ad fuller on leg stump, on-driven to deep midwicket for one
McLaren to Marsh, FOUR runs pretty full and wide and Marsh leans into it to drive it handsomely though the covers for a beautiful four
McLaren to Marsh, 1 run drives this one uppishly, it goes in the air but wide of point to deep point for one
McLaren to Bailey, no run length delivery pretty wide outside off, Bailey slices it and Miller does a Jonty with his left hand at point to stop that one
McLaren to Bailey, no run slower delivery at 117kph well outside off, he chased and was beaten by the deceptive pace
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run length delivery well outside off, driven through the covers for one
McLaren to Marsh, no run angled in towards off stump on length, pushed back to the bowler
Philander to Bailey, 1 run well outside the off stump, Bailey taps it towards the slips area for one
Philander to Marsh, no run fullish outside off, driven with a forward lean to cover

Philander to Marsh, OUT that's gone through, what a delivery from Philander! It pitched outside off and seamed in a bit, Marsh looked to guide it on the off side but left a big gap between bat and pad and the ball sneaked through that to make the bails fly!
Philander to Wade, 1 run outside edge runs down to third man as Wade looked to play the delivery to the leg side
Philander to Bailey, no run full and outside off, driven straight to short cover
Philander to Bailey, no run back of length outside the off stump, Bailey defends it off the back foot
McLaren to Wade, no run angled across outside the off stump, Wade lets it go
McLaren to Wade, 1 run length delivery with the angle outside off, guides it to third man for one
McLaren to Bailey, no run swing and a miss! Full and wide, and shaping away as Bailey reaches out to drive but doesn't connect
McLaren to Bailey, no run beaten! This one was closer to the batsman as he poked at the length delivery that came in a touch but not enough to come on to the bat
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run shaping away a bit this time, big drive outside off and a thick edge flies to third man
McLaren to Wade, no run back of length outside the off stump, he stays back and defends it on off
Philander to Bailey, 1 run back of length towards the stumps, tucked to the leg side for one
Philander to Wade, 1 run fuller on the middle stump, pushed towards mid-on little uppishly
Philander to Bailey, 1 run pretty full outside off again, driven through the covers for one
Philander to Wade, 1 run touch back of length and swinging towards leg stump, worked to fine leg for one
Philander to Bailey, 1 run back of length outside off and shaping away from the batsman, tapped towards point off the back foot
Philander to Wade, 1 run shot of length towards the stumps, tucked off the back foot to the leg side
McLaren to Wade, 1 run short ball angled across outside off, sliced off the back foot to deep point for one
McLaren to Bailey, 1 wide strays down the leg side this time for a wide
McLaren to Bailey, no run angled in towards the batsman just outside off, defends it off the back foot
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run angled in sharply into the batsman from back of length, tucked to backward square leg
McLaren to Wade, no run outside the off stump and angled across, tapped on the off side off the back foot
McLaren to Wade, no run shapes it away from the batsman, it was 118kph and a thick edge went towards the flying slip
McLaren to Wade, no run towards the stumps from back of length, defends off the back foot
Behardien to Bailey, no run length delivery outside off, pushed down to mid-off
Behardien to Bailey, 1 run fullish around off stump, pushed to clear short cover and they take one
Behardien to Wade, 1 run back of length going outside the off stump, taps it late to short third man for one
Behardien to Bailey, 1 run cuts it into the batsman from short of length, helped to backward square leg
Behardien to Wade, 1 run short of length again, the extra bounce gets an upper edge to third man for one
Behardien to Bailey, 1 run fuller outside off, turned with the wrists to long on for one
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run steers the back of length delivery from outside off to sweeper cover
McLaren to Wade, no run fuller on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long off
McLaren to Wade, no run offcutter on the leg stump, a thick edge runs down to short third man
McLaren to Wade, 1 run shorter and wider outside off, sliced off the back foot past third man to third man
McLaren to Bailey, no run angled in towards middle and leg, he defends it to the leg side
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run chops the back of length delivery outside off to third man for one
Steyn to Bailey, no run 132kph, back of length just outside off, he defends off the back foot
Steyn to Bailey, 1 run 135.6kph, shapes the ball into Bailey, who is left with no room and defends it to leg for one
Steyn to Wade, 1 run on the off stump, Wade defends it from back in the crease with soft hands and sets off for a run quickly despite du Plessis' direct hit at the bowler's end
Steyn to Bailey, 1 run tucks the back of length delivery to the leg side for one more quick single
Steyn to Wade, FOUR runs short and wide, he gets room this time and chops it hard past point for a four, right in the gap to beat third man as well
Steyn to Wade, 1 wide strays down the leg side for a wide
Steyn to Wade, no run back of length just outside off and he taps it close to himself
Morkel to Bailey, no run short outside off, slapped off the back foot fiercely before cover point stops it
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run sharp movement off the pitch from back of length, Bailey adjusts at the last moment to guide it to third man
Morkel to Wade, 1 run towards the off stump, Wade runs it to third man off the back foot
Morkel to Bailey, FOUR runs what a shot! It was pitched up on the off stump, Bailey drove it straight down the ground over the bowler's head for a cracking four
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run back of length this time, clipped to the leg side off the back foot
Morkel to Wade, 1 run moves across towards the off side, worked to short fine leg for one
Steyn to Wade, 1 run full and wide, Wade swishes and gets a run to third man
Steyn to Bailey, FOUR runs short outside off and that's been pulled off the back foot to the midwicket area for four. Bailey picked up the length and got on the back foot in time to pull it
Steyn to Bailey, 1 run on length outside off and it's tapped towards cover point for one
Steyn to Bailey, no run outside off and he defends it off the back foot
Steyn to Bailey, no run length delivery on the stumps, he defends it on off
Tahir to Wade, 1 run flighted and full on leg, clipped to midwicket for one
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run half tracker on the stumps, pulled to deep square leg only for one. It was a very poor delivery
Tahir to Wade, no run googly turning towards off from middle stump, he defends it late on the off side
Tahir to Wade, 1 run fuller outside off, punches a drive to collect one
Tahir to Bailey, no run full and flighted outside off, Bailey blocks it back
Tahir to Bailey, 1 run googly turning in form length, pushed to mid-on for a quick single
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run taps the back of length delivery on the off side for a single
Morkel to Wade, 1 run takes a step towards the off stump and tucks the ball behind square on the leg side for one
Morkel to Bailey, 1 run short ball outside off, Bailey pulls and gets a thick edge to clear midwicket. That's the fifty partnership
Morkel to Wade, 1 run another run out chance - Wade tapped it to point, Amla got a direct hit but Bailey responded quickly for the call and he made it just in time
Morkel to Bailey, 1 leg bye towards te leg side and it goes off the pad towards square leg for one
Morkel to Wade, no run length delivery angled across the batsman, he swishes it on the off side

McLaren to Bailey, 3 runs dropped - that's gone high in the air, Philander is chasing the ball from mid on after Bailey lofted the full delivery. He was running backwards and got hands to it, but it was too tough
McLaren to Wade, 1 run length delivery outside off, pushed down to mid-off for a quick single
McLaren to Bailey, 1 wide charges down, McLaren bangs it in short, he pulls but misses. Called a wide because that went over his head
McLaren to Bailey, no run touch short of length outside off, defends it on the off side
McLaren to Bailey, 1 wide this slower delivery goes down the leg side as Bailey looked to pull. Wide called for the width now
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run angled into the batsman now, pushed to midwicket for one
McLaren to Wade, 1 run short and wide, cuts it firmly to backward point where a fumble form Miller gives them a run
McLaren to Bailey, no run back of length towards the of stump, he defends it back
Philander to Wade, 1 run full outside off, Wade swishes it over cover point for one
Philander to Bailey, FOUR runs short ball outside off, clears his front leg and swats it down to the long on boundary for four! He connects those very well
Philander to Bailey, 1 run makes room and slap-pulls it down to long on for one
Philander to Wade, 1 run full and wide again, Wade slices it over the infield to deep point for one

Philander to Bailey, 2 runs short ball, pulled in the air and he's dropped, but it looks like Behardien, who was running in from deep midwicket, has hurt his left shoulder. He dived forward for the catch and got his hands to it, but landed on his left shoulder while falling and he's still lying flat on the ground. Oh he's up, holding his shoulder and is walking off
Philander to Bailey, 1 run charges down and taps the full delivery outside off to deep cover and that's his fifty

McLaren to Bailey, SIX runs that's in his zone and it's gone all the way! Pitched up just outside off and he slammed it straight down the ground for a massive six, it landed in the top tier above the sight screen. So a new ball, rather a replacement is required. The TV says it was 104 metres
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run angled in from back of length, tapped off the back foot towards point for one
McLaren to Wade, 1 run slower at 123kph, he opens up for the short ball and pulls it to deep midwicket for one
McLaren to Bailey, SIX runs he doesn't care if mid off is in or deep, he's clobbered that with the angle to the midwicket boundary for a massive six! Made room, got the angle and tonked it!
McLaren to Bailey, 1 run full on off, driven firmly down the ground and McLaren gets a leg to it
McLaren to Wade, 1 wide short and wide outside off, left alone and that's a wide
McLaren to Wade, no run comes down, McLaren bangs it short again, Wade pulls but misses
Steyn to Bailey, SIX runs slower delivery at 119.6kph, it's full, but Bailey has picked it and hammered it down the ground. Will long-on catch that, he tries but that's gone over him

Steyn to Bailey, OUT another one goes high in the air, Faf is chasing this time and he's running back a long way from mid-off and completes an outstanding catch over his head, while falling down. It wasn't full but Bailey lofted it again, but couldn't clear the fielder this time
Steyn to Wade, 2 runs short ball on the leg side, pulled to deep square leg for two
Steyn to Wade, 1 run outside off stump on length, tapped to third man for one
Steyn to Maxwell, no run pushes the back of length ball to point
Steyn to Maxwell, no run fuller on the off stump, he goes back and blocks it

Steyn to Maxwell, 2 runs that's gone high in the air towards deep midwicket, but Tahir misjudges it! It was short, he pulled and that should have been taken but Tahir came too much inside and the ball went over him, luckily for SA he stopped the four
Steyn to Maxwell, FOUR runs short and wide outside off this time, he makes room and slams it over point in the air for four
Steyn to Maxwell, FOUR runs Steyn pitches it short again, Maxwell makes room again and gets a leading edge over the keeper's head for another four
Steyn to Maxwell, 1 wide full and down leg, goes for a wide as Maxwell leaves it

Steyn to Maxwell, 2 runs another one goes high, but this one lands safe right in between midwicket and long-on! Maxwell miscued a heave and that went high on the leg side but outside the reach of the two fielders
Steyn to Maxwell, no run makes room for a big swing and misses this time! It wasn't a short ball, came in with the angle and just missed the leg stump

Steyn to Maxwell, FOUR runs that's very clever, four more! He went back and across, the ball was angled towards the stumps and he helped it in the air by lofting it wide of deep fine leg and found the gap between square leg and fine leg
Morkel to Johnson, no run makes room for the short ball, looks to swat it but misses

Morkel to Johnson, 1 run short ball again and that was nearly taken at point! Johnson tapped the delivery in the air, wanting to clear point but it wasn't going too far. Miller ran towards the boundary and nearly caught it
Morkel to Maxwell, no run he makes room for the short ball, lets it go thinking it's a wide but it's not given
Morkel to Maxwell, no run they are bowling short again and again, Maxwell wants to pull and misses

Morkel to Maxwell, OUT it's full this time and it's worked, taken at mid-off! Maxwell made room, got it full and wanted to clear mid-off with a lofted drive but Faf did well to dive forward and to his left for a good low catch. They are checking with the third umpire if it was taken cleanly, it has. And a part of Morkel's heel was marginally inside the crease or it
Morkel to Coulter-Nile, 1 run short outside off, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket
Tahir to Wade, 1 run makes room for the flighted ball and heaves it to deep midwicket for one
Tahir to Maxwell, 2 runs slightly full on the stumps, pushed down the ground to long on and they come back for two
Tahir to Maxwell, FOUR runs
Tahir to Maxwell, no run flighted and full outside off, driven straight to cover
Tahir to Maxwell, 1 run takes a step down, Tahir pitches it short and Maxwell tucks it on the leg side for one
Tahir to Wade, FOUR runs hammered! Wade made room, got a fullish deivery and tonked it over the bowler's head for a four straight down the ground
Philander to Maxwell, FOUR runs another boundary! It was full and wide, Maxwell chased and got a thick outside edge for a four to beat third man for four
Philander to Maxwell, no run oh, he tries to reverse slap the full delivery, doesn't connect and even falls down
Philander to Maxwell, 1 run full this time and it's driven firmly down the ground, long-off cuts it inside the boundary
Philander to Wade, OUT outside the off stump, Wade makes room to slice the ball from outside off but finds a fielder in the deep, as Rossow ran in from sweeper cover. He's a sub for Behardien
Philander to Maxwell, 1 run nearly in the block hole outside off, digs it out towards point for one
Philander to Johnson, 1 wide full and swinging down leg for a wide
Philander to Johnson, no run keeps a bit low as he stays back and tucks the length delivery on the pads to the leg side
Steyn to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs short ball around off and he clears midwicket to find the gap in the deep for two on the leg side
Steyn to Coulter-Nile, no run short and not too wide outside off, NCN makes room to slap it but misses
Steyn to Coulter-Nile, no run another short delivery, another attempt to heave it on leg, another swing and a miss
Steyn to Coulter-Nile, 1 run rocks back and across, expecting the short ball, and pulls it to square leg
Steyn to Johnson, FOUR runs makes room, Steyn pitches it on back of length and Johnson punches it off the back foot down the ground for a four! He adjusted very well in the and and found the gap too
Steyn to Johnson, 2 runs makes room one more time, tucks the ball to the leg side as it's pitched up and they take two

Morkel to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs the first one goes for four! It was chipped down the ground, Philander chased from mid-off and tried to keep it in with his leg on the slide, but he only deflected it for four
Morkel to Coulter-Nile, 1 bye makes room to pull, misses, but they run a bye before anyone realises it
Morkel to Johnson, 1 leg bye full and outside off, tapped a bit wide of de Kock for another
Morkel to Coulter-Nile, 1 wide too short and wide outside off, called a wide
Morkel to Coulter-Nile, 1 run short ball outside off, slap-pulled to deep midwicket for one
Morkel to Johnson, FOUR runs one more edge flies away for four! MJ made room for the heave, he did heave but got a thick outside edge and that one flew over the slip are for four
Morkel to Johnson, 2 runs MJ pulls it to deep midwicket, they are running hard and want to come back for the second, they do as Morkel collects and wants to bang the ball on the stumps and misses

3.25pm They were 60 after 10 overs and have finished on 300 after 50. The difference is they have scored 104 in the last 10 overs with the help of Bailey, Wade and Maxwell. They were 144 for 5 at one point as Philander rocked them. Bailey rescued them from there and Philander finished with 4 for 45. Is 300 enough in front of Amla, AB, Faf and co.? We'll know soon...
Faf du Plessis is at No. 3
Johnson to Amla, 1 run bangs in the short ball outside leg, Amla was already on the back foot and he pulled it for one
Johnson to de Kock, no run 147.7kph, back of length outside off, he defends it off the back foot
Johnson to de Kock, no run fuller outside off, pushed back to the bowler
Johnson to du Plessis, no run 148.4kph, angles across a length delivery outside off, left alone
Johnson to du Plessis, no run short ball at 146kph, it's pulled and goes to midwicket after a bounce
Hazlewood to Amla, 1 wide bouncer from Hazlewood down the leg side, called a wide
Hazlewood to Amla, 1 run short of length outside off, pushed off the back foot past point for one
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run length delivery outside the off stump, he defends it back
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs back of length outside off, he punches off the back foot and gets a thick edge flying past the slips for two to third man
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 143kph, good-length delivery outside off, he goes back and blocks it
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run brings the ball in a bit from outside off, Faf guides it to third man for one
Hazlewood to Amla, FOUR runs that's been punched off the back foot for four! Back of length outside the off stump, he went back in the crease and found the gap between cover point and point for four
Johnson to du Plessis, 3 runs that's too full outside off, Faf drives it with the angle through the covers for three
Johnson to Amla, no run outside the off stump and he defends it towards cover point
Johnson to Behardien, no run full and angled across from him well outside off, left alone
Johnson to Behardien, no run beaten by pace, that was 146kph! Back of length and he gets the angle again, the batsman pushes and misses
Johnson to Behardien, no run much closer to the off stump, short of length again, and he defends it off the back foot
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run 142.7kph, bangs it in short outside off, Faf defends it back
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run nearly another one! That was a beautiful delivery - pitched outside off on length, Faf poked and was beaten because the ball shaped away from him
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run angled in this time towards the batsman, he tucks it to midwicket
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run fuller delivery towards the pads, glanced to fine leg for one
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run short of length just outside the off stump, solid defence off the back foot
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run length delivery coming in a bit from outside off, driven to mid-off off the front foot
Johnson to du Plessis, no run full and wide, Faf drives, but doesn't middle it and it goes to mid off
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run short ball outside leg, pulled to deep fine leg for one
Johnson to Behardien, no run 146.5kmh, bouncer in the line of the stumps, Behardien ducks and sways out of the line
Johnson to Behardien, 3 runs full and wide, too much room and Behardien drives it through the covers. Maxwell ran to the boundary and dived outside the rope to cut the ball in
Johnson to du Plessis, no run on length outside the off stump, solid defence from Faf
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run towards middle and leg, clipped off the pads to fine leg for one
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run length delivery outside off, it comes in a bit and Faf defends it back
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run outside off again, punched off the back foot to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run back of length outside off, he goes back punches to mid off again
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run fuller outside off and that's driven firmly to cover
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, FOUR runs too full, and it's on the pads, driven beautifully through the on side with a flick of the wrists. Very-well timed for four
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run outside off, Faf defends off the back foot
Hazlewood to Behardien, 2 runs fullish on the pads, flicked on the leg side towards deep midwicket for one
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run back of length outside off, he defends it back
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run touch fuller outside the off stump, pushed to cover
Hazlewood to Behardien, 3 runs cuts it in from outside off, Behardien drives it nicely through the covers in the gap for three
Hazlewood to du Plessis, FOUR runs length delivery, but it's going towards the pads and Faf is not going to leave that one. Flicks it off the pads to find the midwicket boundary again
Hazlewood to du Plessis, no run back of length outside off and it's left alone
Coulter-Nile to Behardien, no run bangs it in short around off, Behardien hops on his toes and defends it
Coulter-Nile to Behardien, no run outside the off stump again, punched to cover this time
Coulter-Nile to Behardien, FOUR runs too short outside off with width and Behardien punches it off the back foot past point after waiting for the ball to come to him and collects four
Coulter-Nile to Behardien, no run defends the ball outside off on the back foot

Coulter-Nile to Behardien, FOUR runs another four! Mid-on wasn't near the edge of the circle, was a bit wide too and Behardien drove the fullish delivery down the ground past a diving Smith at mid-off for four
Coulter-Nile to Behardien, no run length delivery outside off, it's pushed to cover
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run short ball outside off, he taps it down to third man for one
Hazlewood to Behardien, no run back of length outside off, defended off the back foot
Hazlewood to Behardien, 1 run shorter outside off, Behardien guides it off the back foot to third man
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 2 runs tries a yorker on the stumps, clipped to the leg side in the gap for two
Hazlewood to du Plessis, 1 run stays on the back foot and tucks it to the leg side
Hazlewood to Behardien, 1 run goes back in the crease and steers the ball to midwicket for one
Coulter-Nile to Behardien, 2 runs length delivery coming into the batsman, clipped to the leg side for two
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run back of length outside off, he moves towards off and leaves it
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run short of length and just outside off, AB looks to punch it but doesn't middle it, thick inside edge
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run closer to the batsman, who goes towards off again and defends it on leg
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, FOUR runs shortish again, it's a bit too wide again and AB punches it off the back foot between cover point and point for four
Johnson to du Plessis, no run 145kph, angles across the ball and Faf defends on off
Johnson to du Plessis, no run touch wider outside off and Faf taps it towards backward point
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 bye wider outside off, it's left alone. But they sneak in a bye after Wade fumbles
Johnson to de Villiers, no run outside off on length, AB lets it go to the keeper
Johnson to de Villiers, 3 runs nearly another wicket - AB pulled the short ball from just outside off and it went wide of midwicket
Johnson to du Plessis, no run fullish on the stumps, driven down firmly and MJ stops it with one hand, his left, and throws it back but wide of the stumps
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run brings the ball in from outside off, AB chops the ball to third man off the back foot
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run defends the length delivery from around off to point
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run drives the length delivery straight down the ground to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, 2 runs short ball, Faf gets in line and pulls it to deep midwicket for two
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run takes a step down the ground and smashes it to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to du Plessis, no run full on off stump, driven down to mid-off again and that's drinks
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run short of length outside off, turned to midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, no run back of length outside off, taps it to point
Marsh to du Plessis, no run fuller on the off stump and he blocks it to point again
Marsh to du Plessis, no run charges down for a swing, but he misses as the ball comes in to miss the bat and the leg stump
Marsh to du Plessis, no run full on the off stump, digs it down to mid-on
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs touch shorter outside the off stump, sliced past point towards third man
Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs comes down first ball and whips the incoming delivery bit wide of deep midwicket
Watson to de Villiers, 1 run back of length outside off, defends it on the off side
Watson to du Plessis, no run punches the short of length delivery from outside off to mid-off

Watson to du Plessis, SIX runs hooked and that just clears fine leg! Short ball was angled in, he took a step down too and got a leading edge, the ball went high and over Marsh who tried with his right hand
Watson to Miller, no run nearly played himself on! He wanted to leave the delivery that was angled across, but withdrew his bat bit too late and an edge rolled down to keeper
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run full on the stumps, pushed down the ground to mid-on for a quick single
Marsh to Miller, 1 run back of length towards the pads, worked wide of mid-on for one

Marsh to de Villiers, no run loud appeal for lbw, he's been given out by the umpire but AB reviews it! The ball came in from off stump to trap him in front of leg stump as it came in, there doesn't seem to be an inside edge. HawkEye says it was missing leg stump, AB survives
Marsh to de Villiers, no run full on the stumps, driven down to the bowler who stops it
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run wider outside off, sliced off the back foot to deep cover
Marsh to Miller, 2 runs another edge - it flies wide of the slips. Miller was on the back foot to defend it but the ball shaped away and a thick outside edge went to third man
Watson to de Villiers, no run brings the ball in sharply towards the stumps, AB defends it on off

Watson to de Villiers, 1 run another leading edge off the short ball - AB pulled that short ball half-heartedly while coming down the track and the ball went in the air fine down the leg side, bit far from fine leg
Watson to Miller, 1 run outside off, pushed into the covers by Miller for one
Watson to de Villiers, no run angled in towards the batsman, AB blocks it back
Watson to de Villiers, 1 run another short ball, it's pulled to deep midwicket for one
Watson to Miller, no run length ball outside the off stump, left alone
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run brings in the ball from outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
Marsh to Miller, FOUR runs full and wide, that's too wide for Miller and he cashes in by crashing it through the covers for four
Marsh to Miller, no run short of length outside off, pushed to cover
Marsh to Miller, no run back of length on middle and off, punched off the back foot to mid-on
Marsh to Miller, no run touch shorter and angled across, Miller looks to swat the ball on the leg side but the ball goes under his bat
Marsh to Miller, 1 run fuller on the pads, flicked to the leg side for one more
Watson to Miller, no run fullish outside off, pushed down to mid-off off the front foot
Watson to Miller, 3 runs puts his front foot across the off stump and flicks the ball to the leg side for three in the gap
Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs angled into AB now who turns it on the leg side for two
Watson to de Villiers, FOUR runs too full, AB punches it down the ground with a straight bat and that beats mid on too
Watson to de Villiers, no run length delivery is pushed down to mid on
Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs makes room by moving to the leg side and swats the short ball to deep point for two. Maxwell runs in the deep and saves two runs with a dive
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run full on the stumps, driven down to long-on for one
Maxwell to de Villiers, no run flattish on middle and leg, pushed to the leg side
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run fuller outside off, punched down to long off
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run slower and on length outside off, pushed to sweeper cover for one
Maxwell to de Villiers, no run fullish outside off and that's driven straight to cover
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run comes down the track and drives it to long off for one
Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs coming in a bit from off stump, AB defends with soft hands towards point and takes a single. An overthrow from Maxwell concedes an overthrow
Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs short ball and that's pulled to deep backward square leg for two more
Watson to de Villiers, 1 run fullish outside off, punched down the ground to mid off
Watson to Miller, no run angled across outside off, pushed off the back foot to cover

Watson to Miller, 2 runs back of length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover for two in the gap
Maxwell to de Villiers, no run comes down the track to drive the delivery but takes it on the pad outside leg
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run works the ball with the turn to the leg side
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run fullish on the pads, clipped to backward square leg for one
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run flighted and full on off, driven to cover point by making some room
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run turning it away from Miller outside off, thick edge goes to short third man for one
Maxwell to de Villiers, no run turning this one into AB who pushes the ball back to the bowler

Marsh to Miller, 1 run fuller on the pads, flicked to deep square leg for one
Marsh to de Villiers, no run outside the off stump, AB defends it on the off side
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 wide strays down the leg side past the batsman with a wide
Marsh to de Villiers, 1 run full around off, punched down the ground to mid off for one
Marsh to Miller, FOUR runs that's too wide outside off now and Miller frees his arms with a swing and crashes the ball past point for a four
Marsh to Miller, no run length ball towards off, pushed towards cove point and he goes back in the crease
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run short outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
Hazlewood to Miller, 2 runs full on the pads and it's flicked in the gap on the leg side for two
Hazlewood to Miller, no run looks to flick the ball off the pads again, but it's shorter now and he doesn't connect this time. Takes it on the pad
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run angled across the batsman, who drives the ball with the angle to deep cover
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run short outside off again, punched off the back foot on off again

Marsh to Miller, no run angled across the batsman, he leans forward and blocks it
Marsh to Miller, 2 runs towards the pads now, tucked away wide of fine leg for two

Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run outside off on back of length, AB defends off the back foot

Hazlewood to Miller, no run outside the off stump on length, Miller puts a foot forward and leaves

Maxwell to Miller, 1 run length delivery outside off, he defends on off but inside edge goes to the leg side for one

Maxwell to Miller, no run flighted around off stump, defends it back to the bowler

Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run outside the off stump, punched off the back foot to deep point
Coulter-Nile to Miller, 1 run that's in the air, will he be taken? Miller pulls the short ball, leading edge goes towards fine leg but falls just short of the fielder

Coulter-Nile to Miller, 1 run back of length on the leg side, tucked off the pads to the leg side for one

Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run comes down the track and pushes the short ball to long on
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run goes back in the crease for short of length delivery, works it to leg for one
Maxwell to de Villiers, SIX runs smacked for six! AB came down the track and heaved the ball with the turn to the midwicket boundary for six! What a way to reach the fifty !
Maxwell to de Villiers, 1 run on the stumps and he pushes it down the ground to long on for one more
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run short of length outside off, punched to deep cover for one
Coulter-Nile to Miller, no run fullish outside off, pushed down to long off for one

Watson to Miller, no run length delivery on the stumps, he defends it back
Watson to Miller, 1 run short of length outside off, tucked off the back foot to the leg side for one
Watson to de Villiers, no run bouncer towards the leg side, AB gets ready and ducks under the ball. First bouncer of the over
Watson to de Villiers, 1 run outside the off stump and it's punched to deep cover for one
Watson to Miller, 1 run fullish outside off, pushed down to mid-off for a quick single
Watson to de Villiers, 1 wide that's the second bouncer of the over as it goes over AB and that's a wide
Watson to de Villiers, 2 runs takes a step down the ground and guides the ball to third man after the bounce. That's drinks
Johnson to Miller, 1 wide starts with a bouncer that is too high, and is called a wide
Johnson to Miller, no run what a beauty from Mitch. On a length, just outside off, then moves away from Miller. Beats him. No feet from Miller
Johnson to Miller, no run closer to off, still some swing away, Miller defends well
Johnson to Miller, 1 run full and fast, into the pads, worked away for a single
Johnson to de Villiers, 1 run full and fast, on off, AB goes deep in the crease, square-drives this, gets a single. Not just deep in the crease, it is an exaggerated back and across movement

Johnson to Miller, 1 run draws the edge, but it is a soft edge that falls short and wide of first slip. The singles takes Miller to 50, and to 1000 career runs. Watson's dive at slip saves three runs. Watson's stance is at an angle, and he takes half a step as the bowler delivers. Interesting technique
Johnson to de Villiers, no run short of a length, holding its line around, AB moves back and across again, and defends
Watson to Miller, SIX runs lovely shot. Just a check-drive for a six. He shimmies down the track, takes this on a length, and just lofts it over mid-off. What a clean swing of the arms
Watson to Miller, 1 run short of a length, on off, played with an open face, gets a single
Watson to de Villiers, FOUR runs short of a length, well down the leg side, AB pulls, gets a bit of an edge, bit it is well wide of the diving keeper. That makes him the quickest to 7000 ODI runs
Watson to de Villiers, no run appeal for a catch down the leg side as Watson pitches short of a length. He has only kissed the pocket on the way, though
Watson to de Villiers, 1 run down the wicket, Watson bowls a slower one, which AB drives to mid-on for a single
Watson to Miller, no run another slower ball, on a length, on the pads, turned to midwicket
Johnson to de Villiers, 3 runs full, outside off, AB goes back and across again, and turns this yorker into a half-volley, driving it past extra cover for three
Johnson to Miller, no run that's quick, at 145ks, on a length, nipping in a little, hitting the inside edge on the way to his pad
Johnson to Miller, no run another ripper from Johnson. Cross seam but it swings away from just outside off. Miller in tentative in defence, and is beaten
Johnson to Miller, 2 runs nicely driven on the up, wide of sweeper-cover, comes back for the second
Johnson to Miller, FOUR runs full, into the pads, sweetly flicked away, past midwicket, and is timed well enough to beat the man in the deep
Johnson to Miller, no run yorker, just outside off, dug out to cover
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run guides the ball to third man from just outside off after it pitched on back of length
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run short ball around the off stump, pulled with a thickish inside edge towards midwicket
Hazlewood to de Villiers, no run little slower and full on the off stump, driven down the ground to mid off
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run back of length and angled in, AB makes room and punches it to deep point
Hazlewood to Miller, no run angled across outside off, punched to cover
Hazlewood to Miller, 1 run full on the stumps, driven down the ground and they get only one as mid-off cuts it

Coulter-Nile to Miller, OUT the bowling change as done it, Miller is gone and this strong stand is broken! the length delivery was angled in towards the pads, Miller looked to flick it towards cow corner but played the shot early and even though he looked towards wide long on, the ball went straight to mid on. Marsh takes a few steps back to complete the catch and
Coulter-Nile to McLaren, no run bangs in the bouncer at 138.7kph, McLaren ducks under it
Coulter-Nile to Philander, 1 leg bye outside the leg stump and it's tucked to the leg side for one off the pad
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run taps the fullish delivery outside off to third man for one
Coulter-Nile to Philander, no run one more short one, Philander looks to pull but changes his mind
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run comes down the track and smacks the back of length delivery from outside off in the air, falls short of sweeper cover
Hazlewood to Philander, no run here comes another bouncer - coming towards the batsman, he tries to hook but misses
Hazlewood to Philander, 1 run thick outside edge goes towards first slip and falls well short, they even take a single for the fumble
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run pulls the back of length delivery towards short fine leg where the fielder dives and keeps it to one
Hazlewood to Philander, no run beaten! 139kph, outside off, just a touch short of length, Philander pokes and nearly he edged it
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run gets in line with the ball and pushes it down to mid on
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run moves towards off stump a bit more, pushes it on the leg side from middle stump for one

Coulter-Nile to Steyn, no run bangs in the short ball and it's angled in, Steyn defends it towards point and the shoe of his right foot comes out and is left behind in the crease as he took a step outside
Coulter-Nile to Steyn, 1 run angled in from back of length towards leg stump, helped to fine leg for one
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, no run swing and a miss! It was full outside off, AB didn't move much, went for the drive and didn't connect
Coulter-Nile to de Villiers, 1 run back of length and coming in, tapped off the back foot towards third man
Hazlewood to de Villiers, FOUR runs short of length and straight, slapped absolutely straight down the ground, the umpire falls flat on the ground and avoids the ball which goes for four!
Hazlewood to de Villiers, 1 run fullish towards the stumps, heaved on the leg side to deep square leg for one
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run makes some room for the back of length ball outside off, he pokes and misses
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run angled in towards the stumps now, Steyn defends it back

Hazlewood to Steyn, OUT oh, there's a run out and AB's gone! Steyn defended the short ball on the off side towards point, he took a step out but then said no for the single. It's too late because AB is already halfway down the track, Steven Smith (in for Clarke) runs from point, picks the ball and sends in the underarm throw at the non-striker's end, AB is well out
Hazlewood to Steyn, no run fuller on the stumps, pushed down the ground to mid-off and that's the over
Johnson to Morkel, 1 run hello Morkel, face this short ball, Morkel stays back and defends it uppishly past gully for one
Johnson to Steyn, no run short of length on the stumps, he makes room and guides it to gully
Johnson to Steyn, 1 run he's expecting the short ball, it is a short ball and Steyn plays the ramp shot, it lands in front of third man and they take one
Johnson to Morkel, no run makes room to slap the short delivery on the off side, the ball angles in and beats the bat
Johnson to Morkel, 1 wide sends in a short ball down the leg side, it's a wide
Johnson to Morkel, no run bangs it in towards middle and leg, Morkel defends off the back foot
Johnson to Morkel, no run fullish outside off, pushed down the ground tentatively
Coulter-Nile to Steyn, no run Steyn makes room for the short ball, it is a short ball and goes over his horizontal bat as he pulled
Coulter-Nile to Steyn, no run another attempt to pull the short ball, doesn't connect again
Coulter-Nile to Steyn, FOUR runs full on the stumps, Steyn drives it down the ground, that beats mid-on and even goes for four

Coulter-Nile to Tahir, no run Tahir is moving around, expecting the short ball and it goes over him as he ducks, almost down the leg side. Not given a wide
Johnson to Morkel, 1 wide short ball down the leg side for a wide, good take by Wade down leg
Johnson to Morkel, 1 run another short one towards leg, tucked to fine leg off the hips for one
Johnson to Tahir, no run back of length delivery angled away, steered to point
Johnson to Tahir, 1 wide 137.4kmh, bouncer on the middle stump line, he leaves and it's a wide
Johnson to Tahir, no run length delivery, that's a change, and Tahir pushes it towards point
Johnson to Tahir, no run angled in from outside off, sliced to Maxwell at gully
Johnson to Tahir, no run full on the off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
Johnson to Tahir, 1 run short of length outside off, tapped softly nearly the pitch and they take one
Coulter-Nile to Tahir, 1 run angled in from length towards middle and leg, flicked to the leg side for one
Coulter-Nile to Morkel, no run short ball outside the off stump, he defends off the back foot

Coulter-Nile to Morkel, no run angled in from outside off towards Morkel who defends it

Johnson to Morkel, no run 145kmh, fullish on the stumps, Morkel blocks it back

Johnson to Morkel, 1 run short of length outside off, tapped late past a diving gully

Marsh to Tahir, no run back of length and angled in, Tahir defends off the back foot
Marsh to Tahir, no run bouncer angled in again, Tahir tries to play the ramp shot but doesn't connect

Maxwell to Tahir, FOUR runs sweeps the ball that's turning in from outside off, it goes fine and even beats short fine leg for four
Maxwell to Tahir, no run fuller on the stumps, tucked to short fine leg

Marsh to Morkel, 1 run short ball this time and he pulls it straight to deep midwicket
Marsh to Tahir, FOUR runs four more! Back of length outside the off stump, Tahir stays back and crunches it in the gap on the off side for four
Marsh to Tahir, FOUR runs and another one - Tahir hooks the short ball and a top edge flies over the keeper's head for four
Marsh to Tahir, 1 run that's gone high in the air towards point after Tahir lofted the ball from outside off but it falls short again for the fielder who was running in
That's all we have from the first ODI, join us again on Sunday at the same time for the match on the same ground. Till then, goodbye!

7.50pm So Australia go 1-0 up with a 32-run win even though the margin could have been bigger. SA were well on track with that partnership between de Villiers and Miller, and they had hopes even after Miller fell. But AB's run out was the turning point and the short-ball barrage from Coulter-Nile and Hazlewood was outstanding.
Australia won by 32 runs
Player of the match is Nathan Coulter-Nile, AUS
